alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 21 at 3:36PM AKDT until May 21 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...The Salcha River. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive snowmelt runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Temperatures in the lower 70s during the day will lead to increased higher elevation snowmelt. Much of the higher terrain in the upper Salcha Basin has a record amount of snow on the ground for mid-May. Siginifcant runoff from snowmelt will move down the Salcha River over the weekend and into early next week.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings or Advisories. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
